definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: There are many gigantic ice lights there.
sentences.chinese: 有许多巨大的冰灯在那里。

sentences.english: And we can also enjoy the beautiful ice lanterns in Harbin.
sentences.chinese: 我们还可以欣赏哈尔滨的美丽的冰灯。

sentences.english: Memory is just like an ice-made lamp in the park in summer.
sentences.chinese: 回忆就象夏季公园里面的冰灯。

sentences.english: Ice lanterns are sculpted in winter.
Yesterday morning, there was an endless stream of tourists heading to Longqingxia to view the ice lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 昨日上午，前往龙庆峡观看冰灯的游客络绎不绝。

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
skating or ice rink/ice stadium/ice arena
Mohe county in Daxing'anling prefecture 大興安嶺地區|大兴安岭地区, Heilongjiang
Songhua River in Jilin province 吉林省 through Harbin 哈尔滨, a tributary of Heilongjiang 黑龍江|黑龙江
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
